Class RenderableObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • RenderableObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GlobalHelper
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Item, Racer

    public abstract class RenderableObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements GlobalHelper

    RenderableObject

    Abstract class from which all other rendered objects are derived

    The highest level class representing objects rendered into the game world. All Racers and Items that exist in the game world are children of this class. Represents a very basic object to be rendered in the world, holding only position and angle. Besides the constructor and getters/setters, the only other method in this class is the render method, which renders the RenderableObject to the screen in the given location at the given angle.
    Author:
    Daniel Porteous porteousd 696965 *

    • Constructor Detail

      • RenderableObject

        public RenderableObject(double startX,
                        double startY)
        Sets the most basic characteristics of a RenderableObject, namely its position and angle. Anything more specific will be handled in the subclasses extended from this one.
        Parameters:
        startX - In pixels. Horizontal x-coordinate starting position.
        startY - In pixels. Vertical y-coordinate starting position.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(double camX,
                   double camY)
        Renders the object onto the screen based on the position of the camera viewport/position. This is calculated by taking the position of the object minus the current position of the camera, resulting in a position relative to the screen.
        Parameters:
        camX - The current "position" of the camera (not that the camera is rendered, it simply exists in the world) on the horizontal plane.
        camY - As above but on the vertical y plane.

      • getMapX
